summary: Email chain between FBI agents and US Attorney's Office personnel discussing investigative steps regarding Ghislaine Maxwell, including subpoenaing her Amazon records, implementing a mail cover, and analyzing her phone activity to determine if she switched devices.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The target of the investigation; her Amazon purchase records, phone activity, and mail are being monitored to gather evidence and track her movements.

persons.name: Moe
persons.context: A prosecutor from the US Attorney's Office (USANYS) who is reviewing Amazon records and inquiring about subpoenaing data from a Google Nest camera purchased by Maxwell.

persons.name: Eli
persons.role: Detective, NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: A detective on the joint task force who is coordinating the submission of subpoenas to Amazon for Maxwell's records and analyzing her phone activity.

connections.description: Collaborating on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, with Moe from the US Attorney's Office and Eli from the NYPD/FBI Task Force coordinating subpoenas and evidence collection.
Eli is actively investigating Maxwell, seeking her Amazon records, monitoring her phone activity, and implementing a mail cover as part of the investigation.

events.title: Discussion of Maxwell's Amazon and phone records
events.description: Investigators discuss subpoenaing Ghislaine Maxwell's Amazon records, note her purchase of a Google Nest camera, and analyze her decreased phone activity to determine if she switched devices.

events.title: Maxwell purchases Google Nest camera
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell purchased a Google Nest camera, as noted in her Amazon records, prompting investigators to consider subpoenaing associated account data.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell purchased a Google Nest camera via Amazon on August 15, 2019, leading investigators to consider subpoenaing account data from Nest.
A mail cover was active on Maxwell's mail as of June 2020, with results being mailed to investigators, as photocopied mail must remain USPS property and be returned.
Investigators noted Maxwell's phone had become 'a lot less active' recently, with most calls being incoming or voicemails, prompting analysis to see if she had switched phones.
The CAST team was tasked to analyze both Amazon and phone records to better understand Maxwell's activity and potential device changes.
